page.title: 11CLUBS AT COMMONSIDE
page.content: {SCOTTISH WOMEN'S RURAL INSTITUTE MEMBERS DRAWN FROM COMMONSIDE AND DISTRICT MAKE UP PART OF NEWMILL AND TEVIOTHEAD W.R.I. MEETINGS ARE HELD ALTERNATELY IN TEVIOTHEAD AND NEWMILL HALLS EVERY MONTH FROM SEPTEMBER TO MAY. APPROXIMATELY 30 MEMBERS PAY SUBSCRIPTIONS OF Â£2 PER ANNUM, THEIR AGES RANGING FROM 25 TO 80 YEARS. THE SYLLABUS HAS A VARIED CONTENT INCLUDING DEMONSTRATIONS, DRAMA, TALKS FILMS, DISCUSSIONS, HANDCRAFT, CATERING,MEMBERSHIP PARTICIPATION, ANNUAL DINNER AND OUTING. 1985 OUTING BEING TO SEE "BONCHESTER CHEESE" MADE. MOTTO:'FOR HOME AND COUNTRY' {TEVIOTDALE YOUNG FARMERS}DRAWS MEMBERS FROM A WIDE AREA, AGEING FROM 14-26 AND HOLD MONTHLY MEETINGS.{TEVIOTDALE {FARMERS}MEMBERS MEET MONTHLY DURING WINTER MONTHS FOR DINNER IN HAWICK AND HOST A GUEST SPEAKER. FOUNDED 1859.{
